results.title: Rules are good directions (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Explores the child’s world of rules. Involves the viewer in a series of decisionmaking situations which make children aware of the need for rules, ways to judge their fairness and ways to accept responsibility for their enforcement. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Rules and tools
results.creator_credit: Frank Wilson, Timothy Swartz, Pennsylvania State University and WPSX-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Principles of accounting”.
This program focuses on the basic “rules” of accounting - Debits/ Credits and the basic “tools” of accounting - Journals/Ledgers. It is explained and demonstrated by using the basic accounting equation “assets = liabilities + owner’s equity” how to determine which accounts are involved and then to analyse and record transactions using the Debit/ Credit (or double entry) rule. Journals and Ledgers are the tools for recording transactions, with Journals showing a chronological listing and Ledgers maintaining a running total of transactions in each account. Using the rules and tools of accounting it is shown how to finally produce a Balance Sheet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Wilson, Timothy Swartz, Pennsylvania State University and WPSX-TV

results.title: Rugby Union football
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: A description of the fundamental principles of the game of Rugby Union Football. Filmed at Twickenham with the clubs of Richmond and Rosslyn Park, this is a visual explanation of the laws and the skills of the game in a manner which will be helpful to referees, players and spectators.

results.title: Rugby rouses me
results.creator_credit: John Leake, Peter Johnson, Motion Picture Associates, Film Australia, David E. Barrow and Peter Fletcher
results.brief_description: Explores the game of Rugby in Australia at many levels and reveals the dedication, even fanaticism that Rugby engenders alike in players, organisers and supporters. Follows the stages of junior competition, selection trials, state and international competition. Also shows the camaraderie and life-long friendships that are built up amongst the players.

results.title: Rue des Prairies = Meadows Street
results.creator_credit: Alexandre Mnouchkine and Denys de la Patelliere
results.brief_description:
At the end of World War II, Henri, returns from a POW camp to his three children. Life as a widowed father proves very challenging for Henri as the children seem to either get into trouble or turn against their father.

Credits: Producer, Alexandre Mnouchkine ; director, Denys de la Patelliere ; writer, Michel Audiard ; photography, Louis Page ; music, Georges van Parys.
Cast: Marie-Jose Nat, Jean Gabin, France Asselin, Roger Dumas, Claude Brasseur, Leon Zitrone.

results.title: Rue Cases-Negres = Black Shack Alley = Sugar Cane Alley
results.creator_credit: Alex Regis, Michel Loulergue and Euzhan Palcy
results.brief_description:
Martinique-born Palcy, in her first feature, portrays some of the realities of colonialism. Although set in the 1930s the position of the dispossessed is little changed despite the evolution of the political situation as the economy remains in the hands of Martinique-born whites. The story, based on the novel by a black writer from the island, centers on a young boy from a cane-cutter’s village and his grandmother who works hard to provide him with an education as the means of breaking out of the cycle of poverty. The third main character is an old man who tells the boy the history of his people. Awards: Venice Film Festival (1983) Best Actress for Darling Legitmus ; French Academy of Cinema (Cesar) 1983: Best First Film for director Euzhan Palcy.

Credits: Producer, Michel Loulergue, Alex Regis ; director, writer, Euzhan Palcy ; photography, Dominique Chapuis ; music, Malavoi.
Cast: Garry Cadenat, Darling Legitmus, Douta Seck.
